TopicTitle: [1.12.5] Bluedog Design Bureau - Stockalike Saturn, Apollo, and more! (v1.13.0 "Забытый" 13/Aug/2023)

Articles.Content:
Am I doing something wrong or missing some parts? I watched an old video and inside LMA should be some structure, but here it's missing and as you can see, there are clipping issues.  Of course, I can move that part but I guess there is a correct way to do it.

https://postimg.cc/3dyXXjmJ

3 minutes ago, mazer924 said:

Am I doing something wrong or missing some parts? I watched an old video and inside LMA should be some structure, but here it's missing and as you can see, there are clipping issues.  Of course, I can move that part but I guess there is a correct way to do it.

https://postimg.cc/3dyXXjmJ

You are doing it wrong, yes. There's a hidden node inside the decent module engine area. You attach the decent module hidden node to the node in the adapter fairing, not the bottom of the decent engine to the adapter.

Also, might want to attach the legs one by one or take the one with the ladder off symmetry.

Edited December 10, 2022 by GoldForest

1 hour ago, TruthfulGnome said:

You could put Minuteman 3 on it...
 

Holy crap, the feds beat me to it, at least conceptually.

Also which parts am I looking for? Can't seem to find them in the VAB. Unless these parts haven't been released yet?

In the meantime I created a J2-powered smallsat launcher. I named it Little Joe C. The C stands for a bunch of other things. It's the third letter in the alphabet. It can stand for cargo. The first stage uses cryogenic fuels and propulsion (thank you ORANGES!). It may even stand for the glory of Clan Wolverine-wait, no, sorry, wrong space genre. This space is for rockets, not giant robots. Though we do have robotic parts in the game...

Anyway. Pictures!


I couldn't get good launch pictures of it, but it also has an upper/kick stage in the fairing. In total it can lift over 1.7 tons to LKO. Also, I'm using conformal decals now!

Special thanks to @EStreetRockets and @Invaderchaos for ORANGES.

18 hours ago, Artyom said:


Hi, I cannot seem to integrate the Loops with the engines resulting in them overheating and exploding, though screenshots explicitly show being able to do so, either the mod isn't functioning after multiple varying installs or something else is missing. Additionally you stated "(systemheat will) become a BDB dependency but a soft one. Meaning you can remove it without adverse effects and things will work as before" but after adjusting this in the settings the engines continue to overheat and explode despite it's deactivation.

I've been tweaking this on and off for a while now, and I cannot get it to BDB to function without exploding engines either way. 
How do I solve this. 

Are you using any infinite fuel cheats? There is a patch in BDB that rebalances the thermals of engines but it doesnt like infinite fuel.

It could also be some other mod interfering. Please post a mod list (maybe a screenshot of your gamedata will do) and your modulemanager.configcache file. Please also let me know an example of an engine that is exploding so I can look up that engine specifically in your configcache.

You can also try to delete Gamedata\Bluedog_DB\Patches\Thermal\engines.cfg

Edited December 11, 2022 by Zorg

Is it normal for rockets to be awfully expensive? I did Apollo X mission (History of Spaceflight) yesterday and the reward was 100k, while the Saturn V with Apollo and LM costed me over 300k. Usually missions cover the cost of the rocket and leave a margin.

46 minutes ago, Pudgemountain said:

The cost for parts is arbitrary (and tbqh sometimes completely overlooked) so I don't think we've ever looked into it too much. Maybe try boosting the funds return for career?

7 hours ago, mazer924 said:

Is it normal for rockets to be awfully expensive? I did Apollo X mission (History of Spaceflight) yesterday and the reward was 100k, while the Saturn V with Apollo and LM costed me over 300k. Usually missions cover the cost of the rocket and leave a margin.

Are you playing in a stock-scale solar system? If so, that may be the reason. Things which can do a certain mission in vanilla KSP are inherently going to be cheaper than the BDB equivalent (if one exists), because BDB is not balanced for a stock-scale solar system. BDB is balanced the same way stock parts are, but stock parts are overpowered for the stock solar system - that's why rockets designed for the stock solar system always have oversized payloads compared to the rocket. BDB is optimally played at about 2.7x stock scale (JNSQ or 2.7x KSRSS are good choices), which is about quarter of real scale.

If you are playing in a 2.7x scale solar system, such as the ones I mentioned, and rockets are still too expensive compared to an equivalent made of stock parts, then that may be indicative of necessary price rebalancing.

As for contract rewards, to be honest I don't think stock contracts have ever been particularly well balanced when playing with major mods. Increasing contract rewards by a factor of a little over the square root of the solar system scale you're playing at might help without being overkill, since the delta-v multiplier on a rescaled solar system is roughly the square root.

After the first Mun landing the first thing I grabbed with science was ALSEP and thankfully it did not lag where we landed.

Apollo 5 landed on the Polar lowlands of the Mun and unfortunately due to blaring Rock Me Amadeus which caused the crew not being able to hear Mission Control the last mission, the Kerbal States chose the name of the ships to be more patriotic and play patriotic tunes.....The ratings went way down because of it.

As for why Jeb is wearing a Koviet suit....Based on information from "Weather" Satellites and other sources the Koviet's Mun rocket has been blowing up so to taunt make them feel better Jeb put on a Koviet suit we "Borrowed" from that capsule that landed in our land.

In all honesty I just wanted to post ALSEP pictures here lol.
